intro: Septimetula emarginata, commonly known as the margined septima, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive leaf margins, which are notched or toothed, giving it its scientific name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
